addressbook
Class AddressBook

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--addressbook.AddressBook
public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object

This class stores and manipulates a set of Entry objects, each of which contains contact details for a single person. For simplicity, records are uniquely identified by the combination of a person's family name and given names, so multiple records with exactly the same name are not allowed.

The contents of an AddressBook may be read from and written to a simple text file.

Method Detail

load

public int load(java.lang.String filename)
         throws FileFormatException,
                java.io.IOException
Load address data from the specified file. If the specified file exists and is readable, the records are read in, and any existing records are replaced by the new records. If the load process fails for any reason, the existing records are retained.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file to load the address data from.
Returns:
the number of records successfully read in from the file
Throws:
FileFormatException - if the file does not appear to be a valid address book file, or if any of the records is malformed, or if the number of records found in the body of the file is less than the number specified in the header
java.io.IOException - if the specified file cannot be read, or if any other error occurs during reading
See Also:
Entry.read

save

public void save(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.IOException
Save address data into the specified file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing the file.
See Also:
Entry.write

addEntry

public void addEntry(Person p,
                     Address a)
              throws EntryExistsException
Add an entry into the address book.

Parameters:
p - the personal details for the entry
a - the address details for the entry
Throws:
EntryExistsException - if there is already an entry in the address book whose name matches that stored in p.

getEntry

public Entry getEntry(java.lang.String familyName,
                      java.lang.String givenNames)
               throws NoSuchEntryException
Get an entry from the address book.

Parameters:
familyName - the family name of the person
givenNames - the given name(s) of the person
Throws:
NoSuchEntryException - if no entry can be found that matches the names supplied
